oai_dc:dc.dc:description: OSSOLI MOVES AGAINST SMOKE Mrs. L C. French Writes To Women Of Knoxville. Constitutional League Extends Invitation To Housewives To Join Crusade. Ossoli Circle has inaugurated a movement to abate the smoke nuisance in Knoxville and Mrs. E. Crozier French, members of Ossoli Circle, and chairman of the Constitutional league has addressed the following open letter to the citizens of Knoxville, men and women, asking their co-operation in bringing this matter to a successful conclusion: "For many years the housewives of Knoxville have uttered complaints loud and long about the soot and smoke that has been permitted to invade their homes, destroying ruthlessly their clothes and household furnishings, multiplying many times the labor of housecleaning and the cost of the laundry bill. "Many have said to me "Please start a movement to abate soot and smoke and we will help" 'Women of Knoxville, how many of vou will make good an join in the crusade just started by Ossoli Circle to work for a purer atmosphere that will conduce to greater cleanliness, and better health? "The civic committee of Ossoli went before the commission on Tuesday morning and asked for an ordnance that would require factories and engines to consume their own smoke. The reply of the commission was that if some device could be found that would abate this nuisance without working a great hardship on factory owners, they would consent to act in the matter. "I herebv extend an invitation from the Constitutional league to Knoxville citizens, women and men, to meet with this society at the Woman's building Wednesday afternoon at 3 o'clock to hear a proposition made by one who has success- fully put in operation soot and smoke destroyers. "General discussion of the ways and means of bringing about the purifying of our atmosphere will be called for, and it is believed that much will be accomplished if the people will get behind this movement and push with all their might. How many will help? (Signed) "L. Crozier French, "Chairman, Constitutional League."
